channel.description: A debate show anchored by Nidhi Razdan.

item.title: Telangana Survey: Fears Justified?
item.itunes:author: Maya Mirchandani
item.itunes:subtitle: Amid controversy, doubt and apprehension, the K Chandrasekhar Rao government in Telangana has conducted what it calls a "super-hit" mega survey to find out who lives in the state and what their profile is.
item.itunes:summary: Nothing controversial about it, says K Chandrashekar Rao or KCR, the chief minister of the new state of Telangana about a mammoth census survey that's meant to ensure that government schemes go directly to the ones who need it the most. Nonetheless, with a campaign full of rhetoric against people from residual state of Seemandhra, there have been concerns over whether this survey, even if it doesn't have a nativity clause will fuel subtle ethnic profiling and what that may mean, if anything for non-Telangana people living in the capital Hyderabad. What kind of precedent does this set? That's our main focus on the show tonight.
item.itunes:keywords: KCR,Telangana Government,Telangana government survey,Telangana Survey,Left Right And Centre

item.title: India-Pakistan: End of Bonhomie?
item.itunes:author: Maya Mirchandani
item.itunes:subtitle: India-Pakistan: End of Bonhomie?
item.itunes:summary: Ties between India and Pakistan seem to be quickly souring as Delhi calls off Foreign Secretary-level talks with Islamabad after the Pakistan High Commissioner invites Kashmiri separatist leaders for consultations in Delhi.
item.itunes:keywords: India-Pakistan talk,Foreign Secretary-Level Talks,India-Pakistan,Kashmiri separatist,Left Right And Centre

item.title: 'Hindu' Talk Overshadows PM Modi's Inclusive Pitch?
item.itunes:author: Ankita Mukherji
item.itunes:subtitle: The RSS imparts lessons in governance and nation-building to BJP MPs at a Rakshabandan event today. Is the RSS increasingly calling the shots and has its recent Hindu rhetoric overshadowed Prime Minister Narendra Modi's inclusive pre-election pitch?
item.itunes:summary: The RSS imparts lessons in governance and nation-building to BJP MPs at a Rakshabandan event today. Is the RSS increasingly calling the shots and has its recent Hindu rhetoric overshadowed Prime Minister Narendra Modi's inclusive pre-election pitch?
item.itunes:keywords: RSS imparts lessons,BJP MPs,Rakshabandan event,Mohan Bhagwant,RSS,BJP,Sangh Parivar,Hindu ideology,Hindutva message,Narendra Modi,Left,Right and Centre

item.title: Riots Debate: Has it Backfired on the Congress?
item.itunes:author: Ankita Mukherji
item.itunes:subtitle: Parliament witnesses a high-voltage debate on communal violence but Congress Vice President Rahul Gandhi is silent. Has the charged rhetoric vitiated the atmosphere even further and has insisting on this debate now backfired on the Congress?
item.itunes:summary: Parliament witnesses a high-voltage debate on communal violence but Congress Vice President Rahul Gandhi is silent. Has the charged rhetoric vitiated the atmosphere even further and has insisting on this debate now backfired on the Congress?
item.itunes:keywords: Communal violence bill,BJP,Congress,protests in Lok Sabha,communal violence in Uttar Pradesh,Rahul Gandhi,Yogi Adityanath,Asaduddin Owaisi,Left,Right and Centre

item.title: Playing Fast & Loose With India's Forests?
item.itunes:author: Ankita Mukherji
item.itunes:subtitle: Environment activists are now on a collision course with the Centre, as the Union government looks to fast-track clearances to industrial and infrastructure projects. Are India's national parks in danger?
item.itunes:summary: Environment activists are now on a collision course with the Centre, as the Union government looks to fast-track clearances to industrial and infrastructure projects. Are India's national parks in danger?
item.itunes:keywords: Environment activists,Indian forests,NGOs,wildlife conservation,green activists,wildlife projects,climate change,Left,Right and Centre

item.title: Medical Corruption: Finding a Cure
item.itunes:author: Ankita Mukherji
item.itunes:subtitle: From iPads to cash, doctors talk of "big gifts", agree to push drugs on patients.
item.itunes:summary: The first part of an NDTV hidden camera expose shows up, once and for all, the seamy underbelly of the medical profession. How bribes are offered by pharmaceutical companies to doctors to prescribe drugs of their company's brand and how doctors demand everything from hard cash to iPads to expensive cameras. NDTV reporters went undercover for three weeks to uncover multiple instances of medical corruption. Three separate Delhi doctors were chosen at random with shocking results. On Left, Right And Centre, we speak to all the stakeholders to react to this expose. Some of the most distinguished doctors in the country, representatives from the Medical Council of India - the country's medical watchdog - which many argue has been co-opted and chooses to look the other way and representatives of pharma companies.
item.itunes:keywords: Medical corruption,Delhi's corrupt doctors,doctors bribe,medicial prescription,corruption by Delhi doctors,pharma companies,NDTV expose,Left,Right And Centre

item.title: Kamla Beniwal Sacked as Governor: Vendetta or Justified?
item.itunes:author: Nidhi Razdan
item.itunes:subtitle: Huge political controversy over the sacking of Governor Beniwal who had major run-ins with Narendra Modi in Gujarat when he was Chief Minister. The BJP cites serious allegations against the 87-year-old for her removal, but the Congress calls it vendetta.
item.itunes:summary: Huge political controversy over the sacking of Governor Kamla Beniwal who had major run-ins with Narendra Modi in Gujarat when he was Chief Minister. The BJP cites serious allegations against the 87-year-old for her removal, but the Congress calls it vendetta. But what is the real story? That's the big debate on Left, Right And Centre.

item.title: Has Rahul Gandhi Finally Found His Voice?
item.itunes:author: Nidhi Razdan
item.itunes:subtitle: A suddenly aggressive Rahul Gandhi leads a Congress attack on the government in Parliament. Embattled by questions about his leadership, has Mr Gandhi finally found his voice? Or will this end up becoming another guest appearance?
item.itunes:summary: A suddenly aggressive Rahul Gandhi leads a Congress attack on the government in Parliament. Embattled by questions about his leadership, has Mr Gandhi finally found his voice? Or will this end up becoming another guest appearance? We debate on Left, Right And Centre.
item.itunes:keywords: Rahul Gandhi,BJP,Congress,Narendra Modi,Prime Minister,Parliament,Lefr Right And centre

item.title: Uttar Pradesh's Communal Faultline: Who is to Blame?
item.itunes:author: Nidhi Razdan
item.itunes:subtitle: The alleged gang-rape and forced conversion of a young woman in Meerut has created fresh tensions in an area that has seen an alarming rise in communal flare-ups over the last few months.
item.itunes:summary: The alleged gang-rape and forced conversion of a young woman in Meerut has created fresh tensions in an area that has seen an alarming rise in communal flare-ups over the last few months. A new report suggests there is a deliberate attempt at polarisation in those areas which will go for by-elections. Is this cynical politics ever going to stop? Who is really benefiting? We debate on the Left, Right and Centre.
item.itunes:keywords: Meerut rape,Meerut gang-rape,woman gang-rape in UP,Meerut police,woman raped,meerut tense,rape in Meerut,Left Right And Centre

item.title: No to English: Has the Centre Caved In on the UPSC row?
item.itunes:author: Nidhi Razdan
item.itunes:subtitle: The government has given in, now English marks in the UPSC paper won't be counted. But many protesting students, who feel the exam is against Hindi-speaking people, believe it should be scrapped completely. Should the government have given in at all?
item.itunes:summary: The government has given in, now English marks in the UPSC paper won't be counted. But many protesting students, who feel the exam is against Hindi-speaking people, believe it should be scrapped completely. Should the government have given in at all? Is the English language key for the success of civil servants? We debate on the Left, Right and Centre.
item.itunes:keywords: UPSC row,Civil Services Exam,CSAT,UPSC Education,UPSC students,students,Civil Services,Left Right And Centre,English language
